nodes.bodyText: Add more info. What container id?

Why do you need this? I don't see where you use this or why you need a RefCountByteArraySegment. That class is meant to track append leaks, which you do not need to do.
All you need to do in your tests is generate a basic ByteArraySegment, so you don't need these changes here.

What I meant is to add this outside of the entryIterator.forEachRemaining but still withinin the outer for loop.
And when you wait on it, use .get(with timeout) so we don't end up waiting forever.
In that case we also need to make sure the Timeout is something reasonable. If we set it to 5s, then that may not be sufficient to restore all the segments in a container (there could be millions of them).

Thanks for telling that. I am now, taking timeOut as a parameter to the method. The tests which use this method, will pass their timeOut values here.
I will do similar thing for other methods in this class like recoverAllSegments & copySegment in this class in another PR. #5285
Your Javadoc says "creates a backup" yet this method is named get. Consider renaming to createBackupMetadataSegments
